key_responsibilities: manage and coordinate all communications activities, including media contacts
writing press releases and op-eds
responding to press inquiries
newsletter production
maintaining Member website and social media accounts
managing the Member’s DC schedule
requirements: ability to quickly grasp issues and take proactive approach to media relations

office: House Veterans Affairs’ Committee Minority staff
key_responsibilities: establishing and managing relationships with the veterans service organization community
managing relationships with the House Veterans’ Affairs Committee and other Members of Congress
managing relationships with the Department of Veterans Affairs
requirements: minimum of 5 years of managerial experience in a professional office setting
proficient and relevant understanding of the dynamics of both the Republican and Democratic Caucuses, as well as the Executive Branch

position: Director of Scheduling and Special Assistant
key_responsibilities: preparing and managing the Member’s weekly schedule
ensuring the Member remains on schedule throughout the day
attending to the Member’s daily administrative needs
providing strategic guidance for short and long term scheduling and planning of the Member’s activities
working with the Member and senior staff on special projects and assignments
requirements: strong verbal and written communication skills
ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
mastery of Word, Excel, and Outlook
previous Congressional Scheduling, Executive Assistant and operational experience

key_responsibilities: developing and executing aggressive, proactive long-term media and outreach strategy
serving as chief spokesperson
pitching stories and press events to both national and local media outlets
responding to media inquiries
messaging policy and other priorities
maintaining an active web presence and social media profile
writing press releases, op-eds, speeches, talking points, and franked mail
maintaining relationships with different vendors for the purpose of constituent outreach and communications services
working closely with the Member and staff
possibly overseeing staff or interns
requirements: excellent written and oral communication skills
ability to work collaboratively with an active legislative team and District staff in a demanding, fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
desire and ability to develop relationships with California and national reporters
outreach to print, TV, and radio outlets
good sense of humor and positive attitude
ability to respond to challenging situations quickly and strategically

key_responsibilities: answering calls
conducting and organizing tours
processing constituent requests
greeting visitors
assisting with the coordination of the intern program
aiding the office in various administrative duties including transporting the Member to meetings and events as needed
working with Director of Scheduling and Chief of Staff on special assignments and projects
requirements: excellent writing, verbal and strong organizational skills
ability to be a self-starter while working in a fast-paced environment
ability to work in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: significant legislative research
working with the Congressman to draft bills and amendments
building coalitions in support of the Congressman’s legislative agenda
requirements: significant experience with financial services policy

office: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
key_responsibilities: participate in all matters under the Committee’s jurisdiction, including investigations, hearings, depositions, transcribed interviews, and briefings
requirements: attorney with 2-5 years of investigative or litigation experience
ability to work well under pressure
excellent written and oral communication skills
